Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
They're out in number today.
Delicately put.
Nothing delicate about what's coming next, though. Maybe I was just overcompensating.
@BATTLE
Captain, that last battle was rather intense, wouldn't you say?

Fields.MenuText: We've had worse.
It was harder than it should've been.
Like shooting fish in a barrel.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, but that's not the point.
I agree with you there, Captain.
I am not sure what you are insinuating here...
The crew seems a bit unnerved, Captain. You and I know they had the battle under control, but I'm not sure they see it the same way. I believe that something must be done.
We can certainly change the training regimen and ramp up the drills...
Absurd! I am the Mighty Hood, practically perfect in every way. I think what we need is a reminder of what we are all fighting for.
To stand as a bulwark against the repressive force of the Morganas?
That will be the day! I'll paint those hideous visages of those munters all over my riveted walls. What a terrible suggestion, Captain!
... Wait, what?
Lady Hood, what are you doing with all these blueprints?
I am seeing where would be the best place to put it.
Put what?
An art gallery.
But why now?
It serves two purposes, once, give the seamen a bit of a rest, a holiday from the fight, somewhere quiet to go...
Isn't that what your chapel is for?
The Chapel is a place of worship and solemn reflection. It can be renewing, but it isn't meant to be a place for simple relaxation.
Ah. So the gallery will be...
A place of towering grandeur, to be filled with beautiful paintings which showcase and remind everyone what Great Britain is capable of!

Fields.MenuText: And that's condusive to "simple relaxation" how?
I don't suppose there's any point in highlighting space constraints.
Y'know what? I'm just going to trust you can make it work.

Fields.DialogueText: Great Britain is both towering monuments and rolling hillsides. There's no conflict between soothing the soul and making a statement.
Captain, you say "space constraints," but I say "space opportunities."
Most likely a wise move there, Captain.
*ALARM*
Looks like the plans need to be on hold for the time being.
I intend to continue back to where I was, before it's time for tea.
@BATTLE
Y'know, I actually guessed that would be coming one of these days. It just seems very... you.
Bear in mind you're not allowed to seize my cabin and turf me out to sleep in a lifeboat.
I'm sure we could fit a cot in the bridge.
Uh-huh.
Why are all these sheets strewn about?
I need to set up the studio, Captain.
For the paintings?
Aye, Captain! The artisans, masters at their craft, will need somewhere to paint. Seaman! Just put that chair in the portside corner. Yes, that'll do nicely.
With pleasure, Lady Hood!
You see, Captain, in between battles, we don't have all the time in the world to hang out in a port. The Mighty Hood heads wherever I am needed. Thus, we bring the painters here.
I don't mean to be a killjoy, but you know I can't authorize funds to fly out Paul Nash and Meredith Frampton and whoever else.
Never fear, Captain. The painters are paid in the privilege of being in the intimate presence of the most beautiful woman in the entirety of the British Empire.

Fields.MenuText: I guess I can't argue with the price.
It's a fair point. Maybe we should ask them to pay you.
How many painters are there going to be?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a frugal way to embellish my attributes, Captain. Or, I could spend money in a lavish shopping experience at Selfridge's.
That would be tawdry. But I like the impulse, dear Captain.
As many as there needs to be, of course. We'll have to pair each style to the appropriate painting.
But no time to chat about the details. There seems to be Morganas headed in our direction.
@BATTLE
I didn't think to say it before, but I hope you're planning to have your own portrait taken while the artists are here. I might even commission a piece if you think you'd have the time to sit for it.
Oh, Captain, you're just... I'm so happy you know me so well!
One: thank you. Two: all of the artists will be painting, drawing, engraving, whatever you? Every single one?
Why not? As I stated before, this gallery is to showcase the beauty of Great Britain...
Et... voila!  *gestures at herself*

Fields.MenuText: Again, can't argue.
Huh. I just hope it's not going to be too crowded in the gallery.
Which paintings do you specifically intend to have done?

Fields.DialogueText: Right you are, Captain! *lights a cigarette*
Fair point. Best to come at a time you know the mobs won't be there. *lights a cigarette*
You'll see, Captain - I don't want to shock you too much. You need to be top notch for battle. *lights a cigarette*
Might not want to smoke when the painters come. It might cloud your beauty.
I do know when someone's trying to manipulate me, Captain. You need to flatter me more if you expect me to let you get away with it.
*ALARM*
Well, duty calls.
@BATTLE
But you don't need to worry about commissioning a thing. All the artists will be creating portraits of me, and I promise I'll make sure the very best of them go where you can see them!
May I ask you a personal question?
You intrigue me, Captain. By all means!
I can certainly appreciate your interest in aesthetics - but we don't often talk about hobbies or other interests. Sometimes I almost wonder if you have time for anything but being gorgeous.
That's the problem, Captain. Being beautiful is a full-time job. There's exercise, eating properly, spending time on highlighting the features of my face, my hair. It all adds up.
And that's on top of your military duties.
There's also choosing outfits, accessorizing, the list goes on. Honestly, there's no time for hobbies.

Fields.MenuText: That's a lot of work!
What part about being beautiful do you like the most?
What about the cats - do they count as hobbies?

Fields.DialogueText: No one ever said that being beautiful was easy.
That's a fair question! I like how much power it brings. Everyone, everywhere willing to do my bidding all because of my beauty.
I suppose one can say that. I do love doting over my darlings.
Now where did my darlings Ginger and Fishcakes go? Are they down in the galley again being a nuisance to Cookie over tuna cheek?
I'll try to keep an eye out for them.
*ALARM*
No, Captain. They are better off hidden for the time being - while we go take care of the Bitch Fleet.
@BATTLE
*sigh*
If I'm honest... you're not wrong.
Indeed.
You've been smiling ever since we drew the Mediterranean tour. Care to share?
I just love the Italian coastlines.
I also rather expect we'll acquire our master painters while we're in the neighborhood.

Fields.MenuText: I hope they agreed to this. The last thing we need is kidnapping charges from the Italian government.
Do we have the supplies, though? Paints, brushes, canvases?
Right. Do we know if they're any good at painting cats?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain, why wouldn't they agree? Look at me!
Color has come a long way in the centuries! They need to be able to represent the rosè shade of my eyes and my strawberry blonde locks.
Captain! Genius! I should get a few pieces done of those two! They are the mascots of the ship, after all.
So, what are you planning to do while we wait for the new arrivals?
I'll have a glass of wine, I should think. And I suppose I should finally look at those tedious damage reports - though they always exaggerate.
Would it be any better if you had company?
Probably, but one can't force these things. Ginger and Fishcakes have their own lives, Captain.
Uh-huh. Well, if you're willing to settle for a humble-
*ALARM*
I suppose we were asking for that.
@BATTLE
Oh-kay.
Which, in Hoodspeak, means...
The officer should be back with them in no time.
Gladly. But my point stands.
Fine, fine. They have accepted my invitations. No active coercion was involved.
... I'm a bit worried about the potential for passive coercion there.
Beauty, Captain. How could they resist? You shouldn't need me to keep reminding you.
Heh. Granted.
Again we see why you're in charge! So thorough!
But, yes, we've been preparing for weeks. We know all the artists' material preferences, and I'm confident we have enough in stock to keep them going indefinitely.
I believe we've even found a few special pigments that they'll find useful in capturing my special je ne sais quoi.
Cherry red and lemon yellow won't cut it, then?
By the way, I've been forgetting to ask - are you going to try to get the cats in the paintings as well?
Well, clearly.
Right. Just remember, it'll be your job to explain to visiting admirals why there are life-sized feline portraits staring at them in the wardroom.
Oh, you pretend to be gruff, but I can see you love the idea! I am, I believe, the luckiest ship in the fleet.
If that's a compliment-
It is.
-I'll take it.
Captain! Can you make sure I'm free for the next hour?
Barring Morgana activity, that shouldn't be a problem. What's going on?
I want to walk the master painters around the temporary studio that will eventually become the gallery. Let them and the sculptor get a feel for the place.
Sculptor? You got a sculptor too?
Indeed. I want a statue of myself. Really, Captain, you also inspired me earlier...

Fields.MenuText: I did?
Of course I did! That's clearly what I was doing...
Okay, I'll admit to it... I have no idea what inspiring thing I've done and I'm almost too afraid to ask.

Fields.DialogueText: Brilliantly!
No need to fret, Captain, when you have someone as beautiful as me by your side.
Just to be clear, and sure that we're on the same page, how did I inspire you again?
Why, by suggesting we incorporate the ship's mascots and my darlings, Ginger and Fishcakes into the gallery as well. They deserved to be just as immortalized as their Lady.
*ALARM*
Those filthy savages! They're distracting my artists, Captain! The job of capturing my essence requires the entirety of their concentration!
@BATTLE
In fairness, the artists may appreciate your beauty even more after you've saved their lives.
... I really do like you, you know.
You seemed... unexpectedly pleased when you learned we were making for Algeciras. Do we have agents in Spain waiting to deliver Pablo Picasso?
Actually, I need to pick up a white Andalusian stallion for a painting.
Works for me.

Fields.MenuText: So, where will we keep the horse?
Why a white Andalusian?
We need to work up a food list, too. No visit to Spain isn't complete without tapas!

Fields.DialogueText: We'll just have to make a stable. Easy enough. Remember, Captain, I once carried a menagerie in my hull from my tour as part of the Special Service Squadron.
To represent my spiritual purity and raw physical power, I should think.
If you must, Captain. I request that you bring me back the tapas that best accompany my beauty as a culinary experience.
Are you worried that the Morganas might interfere with your plan?
Why would I ever be worried? They're not as beautiful or as well-equipped as myself. Do they have adoring fans? I believe the answer is no.
I thought I would ask. Some people can be afraid of what they don't know or understand.
To put it frankly, they are a thorn in my side. Always at the precise moment of some great decision or emotional release, there they are.
*ALARM*
Just like that, like clockwork.
That's probably too deep to resolve in the next forty-five seconds.
I don't know. We're very clever people, and I know my beauty inspires you.
@BATTLE
So I should choose wisely.
Choose very wisely.
No. I respect the man's work immensely, but abstract portraiture isn't on the cards this time around.
... I suppose it's better than having you sit on a midshipman's back and making the artist imagine a horse.
That's plan B.
I don't know about adoring fans, but I gather that there are crazed cultists.
Don't bring the conversation down, Captain. Adoring fans are adoring fans and nothing else comes close.
It makes one question whether the philosophical concept of free will really applies to pivotal figures in moments of great historical pressure. Maybe, for the likes of you and I, it can only be fate.
*walking through temporary art studio door* Lady Hood I need to ask your opinion on somethi...
Good of you to notice! Tread lightly - I can't have you spooking Percival here. That's the name of this fine beast, Percival. *pats Percival on the neck*
So... you're nude. On a horse. Is this a Godiva theme, or just...?
Sorry to disappoint you, Captain, but I can't turn around to talk to you right now. I need the artist to fully focus.
Better her than me.
I said I was looking back to the classics. The Greeks and Romans explored the foundation of beauty in the unadorned human form, and it seems like a fitting place for us to begin as well.
Lady Godiva! Who rode naked on the streets of Coventry to let others admire her beauty...
I believe it was to ask forgiveness for her husband's high taxes, Lady Hood.
Is that what actually happened, or what the history books lead you to believe?

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't argue with her.
Just paint! Save yourself and just paint!
I'm surprised you didn't start with Venus, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Captain is right, and we must follow Captain's orders.
Don't rush it, Captain! If Rome wasn't built in a day, then It's impossible to fully capture my likeness in a day.
Too obvious, and not nearly British enough.
Don't get too wound up. You don't want to spook Percival there.
*ALARM*
I guess it's into battle, then!
Aren't you going to put any clothes on? The bridge isn't really the right setting for a Boticelli re-enactment.
No time, Captain! This ought to get the attention of those munter Morganas!
@BATTLE
Hello, Captain!
Hello, Hood... You're looking naked today.
Hm?
Sorry. I just... somehow I hadn't realized this was what you had in mind.
And Lady Godiva?
It'll also distract every human in your line of sight, your captain very much included. Get a coat or something.
You're blushing!
We'll revisit this another time.
Captain!
Hood, you have clothes on!
How astute... You've inspired me once again with that "Boticelli on the bridge" idea! I'm going to do the Birth of Venus, but I shall call it the Birth of Vengeance.
Because the Morganas interrupted you for the last painting?
Not in the least. This is to get vengeance on Venus herself - I'll show her who's more beautiful!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry. This is because of something I said?
This beauty ordeal is getting to be serious business.
Please don't pick fights with goddesses. I know enough Classical mythology to know it doesn't end well.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, all for you, Captain!
If I need to be top of the game, then my beauty and adoration needs to transcend time.
Ha! I have more fight in me than Psyche ever did!
This is getting too heated... Where did you put Percival?
He's resting in the makeshift stable since after gallantly charging into the last battle. I have the crew giving him some gelatin and a bit of oil.
Next I need someone to construct a giant clam shell, large enough so Ginger and Fishcakes can sit at my feet.
*ALARM*
At least you have clothes on this time.
@BATTLE
You say that like you're not secretly disappointed.
Lady Hood, let me ask you something...
You may ask me something, Captain.
Aren't you worried that the public nudity is going to... get away from you?
Taboo? Captain, when you go to an art gallery, it is called "art gallery," not "taboo gallery." If it's a painting done by a master painter, it is a priceless work of art.
Granted. But you're really not worried that there might be a cost to discipline if half the crew can tell you in vivid detail exactly where you keep your freckles?
I just don't see the point in working this hard on my appearance only to be covered like an old chair. People like to show off their prized possessions or talents. This is mine.

Fields.MenuText: If this is what you want.
But a whole gallery?
You know, every so often you say something that makes me think that *you* think your appearance is the only important thing about you as a person.

Fields.DialogueText: Indeed, this is what I would like! If you don't have anyone to adore you, how do you know that you're beautiful?
It may seem fanciful right now, but in the future, historians will talk about it just like my Chapel, or my sheer size. Honestly, on a ship this grand, anything is possible.
But I'm glad you care.
I just wanted to make sure this is what you wanted and not what you felt like doing out of obligation.
There's nothing wrong with acting out of obligation, though.
What do you see?
Drat, just my luck! The Bitch Fleet is back in force!
@BATTLE
You foresee a wave of rampant nakedness around the ship, Captain? Interesting.
I'm just saying that there isn't exactly a modern tradition of military leaders parading around in the buff, and it may be taboo for a reason.
Not as long as they also know where I keep my fifteen inch guns.
I'm going to be using "fifteen inch guns" as a euphemism from here on in. Just so you know.
So cheeky.
You know that isn't true, right?
Obviously. I'm also good with cats.
Hood.
I'm joking, Captain. Rest assured, my self of self-worth is limitless, and rightly so.
I mean, there is if the obligation isn't-
If you'll excuse me, Captain. I have an appointment to start of the Vengeance of Venus.
Of course.
Hold on - what's that in the distance there?
Okay, there's a lot of skin again. Can we put a sign on the door saying painting is in session?
Or one could try... knocking. It's an odd concept, I know, but it just might work.
At least though that mirror you're staring into, we can talk face to face if turning is... awkward.
Quite! I thought Rokeby Venus would have its advantages. Once it's finished it will be this metaphorical parable that I'm always watching...
Why are there wire frame shapes with cloth over them holding up the mirror?
It's a dummy. You can't expect Ginger and Fishcakes to stand still all day. One cannot command a cat.
What normally holds up the mirror?
It was a cherub in the original painting, but that isn't really consistent with my inner self. I thought Ginger and Fishcakes would serve as an improved substation.

Fields.MenuText: When did you learn so much about art?
Maybe incorporate some Spanish tapas into the painting.
Is the lighting correct?

Fields.DialogueText: I just go by what the painters suggest, and your Venus suggestions... I'll show Venus who's really in charge.
That does sound like a splendid idea, Captain!
Is there something amiss with the lighting?! I don't want the undertones of my skin to be off.
What's going to be the next painting?
I'm not quite sure yet... Do I stick with the classics, or go with something new entirety?
*ALARM*
Looks like I'll have some time to think about this one. And you needn't worry about modesty this time, Captain - I've brought a robe!
@BATTLE
I've thought about it, and the classics are starting to get a bit drab.
Getting tired of being in your natural glory?
Good heavens, never! That really is a part I rather enjoy, Captain.
I'm all ears for your idea.
I think I'll have a few paintings done in that "pinup" style. I'll be atop of my raised platform MK V gun.

Fields.MenuText: I bet *that* one gets made into about a hundred tattoos within a week of its release.
Is there going to be clothing for this picture?
Will you be able to hold onto the barrel in rough seas?

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? Really? Oh, I do like that.
Quite possibly. The sea air is rather chilling.
I'm not that oblivious, Captain. I'll have it commissioned next time we're in port.
And when are the paintings of Fishcakes and Ginger coming?
Quite soon. I just have another portrait or two to sit for first.
*ALARM*
Into battle we go!
@BATTLE
I'm... glad to have it confirmed.
No, it's the classical motifs that are getting boring - Roman goddesses and medieval maidens There needs to be a new take, something modern, something to represent the times.
But not now.
Lieutenant! Have you seen Lady Hood?
Lady Hood is down in the Mess, Captain. She's getting one of them paintings done.
She's not naked, is she?
I... think I would have noticed.

Fields.MenuText: So, I guess it's time to ask again - are you hearing any complaints from the crew about all this?
I don't know. She can be tricky about getting her clothes off when you're not looking.
Right. Carry on, Lieutenant.

Fields.DialogueText: ... You lucky dog.
I'm going down to the mess to chat with her.
Aye, Captain.
*ALARM*
Getting to my post, Captain!
@BATTLE
I don't know. I don't think her horse likes me.
Heh.
Can't say that I have, Captain. There hasn't been any commotion, either, and that kind of surprises me.
It's Hood. In her own unique way she makes it really difficult to react to her badly. It's not a joke, but if it were everybody would be in on it.
Everybody?
Hm?
I was just wondering if any admirals knew about the Ship's Belle's little burlesque.
The phrase you're looking for is "innocent cultural exchange." And they don't need to know the details.
Understood.
If you're worried she might be naked, I could go check.
Yeah, I don't think that'll be necessary. Just be about your-
I heard you were getting a painting done in here.
When the Bitch Fleet gives us the chance, yes.
The painting is of you lying on the table? Or is this a break?
(With Ginger next to her) This is the very thing, Captain. Aside from my powder room, this is our favorite place to be! Isn't that right, Ginger?
If you made a habit of sprawling out half-dressed on the furniture, you'd get all the attention you could ever want in here.
Hrm. I did like the way the artist had me arch my back in the early sketches.

Fields.MenuText: Excellent. Hey, maybe put some Spanish tapas next to you on the table.
Maybe an image of you on the deck shrouded in smoke should be next. Something a little bit cinematic.
What about some choughs?

Fields.DialogueText: Tapas? Again? We really need to feed you better, don't we?
Splendid idea, Captain! I have just the image in mind.
I didn't forget my treasured choughs, Captain!
Hm. Have you seen what the master painter is doing yet? I mean, the actual painting?
No - and the tone of your voice is very troubling. What do you see?
I think the lighting is off... It's too dark in here to begin with.
Oh, for pity's sake! Lieutenant!
Yes, Lady Hood? Oh... you're sitting for a painting. I'm... well, that is to say, I....
If you stop stammering and look at me for half a second you'll notice I'm dressed.
*cough*
Lieutenant, put more lighting in here immediately. I don't want my skin tone to have a cool color. I have a reddish undertone, it matches my rosè eyes.
Yes... yes, Lady Hood!
*ALARM*
Put up the lightening after we have finished this battle. I suspect we will be done with the Morganas with time to spare.
@BATTLE
I rather like inspiring the crew, but it's probably best to let them eat undistracted. Don't you think?
Well, obviously, that's why *I* don't sprawl around half-naked on the furniture during mealtimes.
I feel a deep and surprising sense of loss.
So how's this painting going?
Hood! You're not being painted today?
I thought I would give my darlings their due. After all, everything can't always be about me.
Sorry to interrupt, Captain. Lady Hood - message for you.
Oh, hmm... how tragic!
What's the message?
It's about a chough population being poached!
Close by?
This is our time to rescue the choughs, Captain. Ventis secundis!
Wait. What am I missing? They're being poached by sea?
Apparently so. Patrols have spotted a small boat going in and out, but compared to the Bitch Fleet it's been too low-priority to pursue.
I say we head there and set up some decoys using black chicken feathers. Any boat that stops to get a good look at the decoys is searched.
How do you tell the regular bird watchers from the poachers?
Simple enough, Captain. Birders won't have the equipment that a poacher would.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a pretty solid plan.
I'm impressed you were able to think of all that in such a short span of time.
How many decoys do you think we need?

Fields.DialogueText: All part of my many hidden talents, Captain. Sometimes I even surprise myself.
When it comes to manipulating others to get what I want, I have an advanced degree.
The Chough is a rare bird, so five tops should garner the attention of any poacher.
Oh drat, looks like we have company... I swear those Morganas are bothersome and unexpected as English weather.
@BATTLE
Close enough. The Isle of Man.
We're only a few hours out from Portsmouth...
I'm surprised the Morganas haven't pursued it, actually.
Fortune favors the wicked, eh? Well, not any more.
What are you doing with my binoculars?
I'm watching the crew set out the decoys. They need to look convincing enough to garner the attention of those wretched poachers.
Lieutenant, signal that chough number four needs to be moved further down, towards the edge of the cliff, like it's contemplating flying off.
Yes, Lady Hood.
You're being very specific about all this.
It's because poachers are after one thing, the birds. Their behavior is much more predictable than the Morganas.
I am once again impressed by your knowledge of behavior.
As I stated earlier, to get what I want takes a bit of psychology. It pays to be well versed in it.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe that's your true talent after all.
No, see, we're out here in the dark protecting innocent birds. I know you like pretending to be totally self-involved, but this is altruism.
Are you sure this plan will work?

Fields.DialogueText: It may be, but if I'm not as beautiful, would it be just as effective? I must remain at the top of my game.
Maybe that's just what I want you to think.
Nothing is certain, but that's all a risk we must take. As long as we can attract the attention of ships in the area, we have our suspects.
Once the crew gets back on deck, we ease off and wait.
@BATTLE
Maybe I like thinking that you want me to think the best of you.
Let's... continue this conversation after we've saved the choughs, shall we?
A ship was spotting glassing over the area! The constables have been called.
It looks like our job here is done...
Not yet, Captain! We need to keep the ship here until the constables arrives. Even then, we need to wait for the press to arrive.
Press to arrive?
Indeed - think of the headlines! "Lady of the Courageous Hood Rescues Rare Chough."

Fields.MenuText: I trust your judgment implicitly here.
Wear your uniform.
If you show up naked on a horse, I guarantee it'll be an even bigger story. Having said that, please don't.

Fields.DialogueText: Words of wisdom, Captain.
My full regalia, if you will. Quite right.
Tasteful eroticism is one thing, sensationalism is quite another.
It appears that Morganas are heading in - we should take care of them so the constables can do their job.
The Admiralty will definitely approve.
"Mighty Hood Rescues Choughs and Defeats Morganas!" Lovely.
@BATTLE
... You know, the Admiralty will probably love it.
Of course they will! They know how powerful a beautiful face and a good story can be!
Hm. What should I wear for the cameras?
... One moment.
Captain! The press shall be here shortly. Tell me how gorgeous I look.
You're doing the interview in your uniform, then?
For the cover picture, I'm using my latest painting. Don't worry, it's not one of the risque ones - very few freckles to count.
Let's see the painting, then!
Follow me, Captain. I decided it was no better opportunity to showcase one of the priceless masterful creations than with the Dawn of Choughs.
As you can see, I am in the center of this panting, atop of the Chough statue. Behind me are my featherful friends, flying towards the viewer in the morning sky.

Fields.MenuText: How very fitting.
I have to say, I'm partial to the nudes.
... Is that the Chough statue from the bathroom parade?

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't it? I thought there would be no better image. It also saves me the trouble of trying to figure out what to wear.
That's fair. But not having any clothing in this scene would have been rather unpractical - the cold sea air, you see.
Indeed, good eye, Captain. Why would I throw away something as grand as this?
You do enjoy being the center of all this attention, don't you?
Why wouldn't I? Being the largest and most beautiful ship in the fleet, I deserve nothing less.
*ALARM*
I don't know if I deserve nothing less than Morganas attacking at every turn, but that is the duty of being a Lady of the Courageous.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I've seen worse.
Staggeringly.
We don't have the time for me to do it justice.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmph. It's a good thing I like you, Captain.
And yet you're still standing!
Weak in the knees, though.
Charmer.
Oh, that's very good. I do like it when you flirt.
Back atcha.
Well, that's kind of the point.
Ha!
Hood? I've just had another exciting round of conversations with a couple of newspaper editors and our friends from the Admiralty. Do you have a minute?
Of course! Do they want more photos?
You know, as long as we're talking about you taking things personally - one might even suspect that isn't accidental that we were in the right place at the right time to deal with those poachers.
Well, clearly. It's very wise to never question any Lady of the Courageous' intentions. All my crew can recite that like a grammar school rule.
Some things are best left as a mystery, Captain. If I were you, I would focus on Morganas, or why there's a shortage of bacon in the mess.
We're out of bacon?
While it is best to leave something to mystery, bacon is certainly not one of them when you have a crew of over 1400 to feed.
*ALARM*
I'll take care of the battle and you get down to that bacon. You're going to have a city-sized lot of grumpy sailors on your hands!
@BATTLE
That's not... actually, okay, yes, they do. But I'm sure they'll talk to you directly.
It's good of them to ask you first, though. I wouldn't want anyone to think I'm not... excited to be under your command. *reaches out and adjusts the Captain's collar*

Fields.MenuText: Guh.
You're trying to manipulate me, and it's not going to work.
You're trying to manipulate me, and I like it.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm.
If you say so.
Ha!
So, what *is* the news, then?
The news is that the chough rescue might not be news.
Pardon me?
"Lady Hood Foils Incursion on Isle of Man" is thought to be a more dramatic headline than "Royal Navy Involvement Leads to Poacher Arrests."
No. That won't do. I want poachers to know that I take endangering the choughs very personally.
I kind of suspected that. Hence this conversation.
... Fine. Yes. I keep tabs on the choughs and I've been hearing rumours for weeks.
And you've been encouraging Command to offer us assignments close by, just in case.
You knew?
I figured something was up. And I figured whatever it was, it was worth doing.
So... do you have any channels I don't know about that might help you get the choughs in those headlines you want?
And the chough coverage?
Let's say I have faith it will take care of itself.
I seem to recall we've talked about the balance between free will and fate before, Captain.
Yeah. But I'm definitely seeing more will in this particular situation.
What a relief!
From what?
The press.
Really? You're glad they're gone?
I know, I know. But sometimes it's good to get back to into a meaningful routine.
Give me a minute to pick my jaw up from the floor.
Don't get me wrong - the attention is delightful. But it's good to have a break from it all occasionally. I need some personal time here and there.

Fields.MenuText: What about the painters?
That's fair. What do you plan to do with said time?
Huh. I'm not sure you've actually had any personal time in all the time I've been on board. Have you?

Fields.DialogueText: They disembarked during my interviews with the press.
Retreat away to my powder room? Go for a nice long soak in the tub? It's almost too delicious to think about.
Talking to you counts. Not much else does.
You're full of surprises lately.
And do you find surprises exciting, Captain? Arousing, perhaps?
I don't know, Hood. Someone told me once that some things are best left as a mystery.
*ALARM*
Well, there's a surprise that definitely isn't arousing.
@BATTLE
They did what we wanted them to, after all. And none were quite handsome enough to keep around as decoration.
Not even to keep your face out inspiring the masses?
I'm not sure it even counts as a surprise.
So I gather the paintings and sculptures are done. What about the gallery itself? I assume you have a plan for the grand opening.
Mm. I've given it a great deal of thought. The best course is to just open it, sans fanfare and pomp.
Again, I'm shocked. You've thrown parades for lesser occasions.
If I just quietly open the gallery, then the crew can experience the art unfiltered, on their own terms.
... Are you just messing with my head right now?
Tsk, tsk. Some things are best left mysteries, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, you're messing with my head.
What if I don't like mysteries?
Just remember that when it's my turn to be bewitchingly inscrutable.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, you love it.
I'm not sure how to help you there, Captain.
I'm looking forward to it.
So. Why don't we make a date of it?
A mystery date?
A gallery date! Let's make a date of it and walk through the exhibition together. Aside from the Dawn of Choughs, I haven't seen any of these either.
*ALARM*
Best to get this battle over quick. The sooner it's finished, the sooner we can have our date.
@BATTLE
Well, that was really my grand introduction to the crew, Captain. This is art.
Why, Lady Hood, I would be delighted.
*KNOCK*
Come in!
Good of you to invite me!
Well. You look radiant.
That went without saying... but I'm glad you said it.
Ready for our date, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, yes.
About that. You do know that there's a pile of reports of Morgana activity in the area...
Eh, whatever.

Fields.DialogueText: Good. This should be brilliant!
There's always a pile of Morgana reports, my dear. It's the world we live in. That's why we have to seize every moment we can!
"Eh, whatever." You're not fooling anyone.
Before we go in, could you put this jacket on?
I didn't know this was a formal event. I thought this gallery was more of a retreat?
It is, Captain! There's no question about that! I just need you to wear this jacket so I can put my belongings in the pockets!
What, now?
I've had your jacket modified to hold my seaside themed clutch, my makeup bag, my cigarette case - you know, all the essentials.
I'm an accessory now?
You do go stunningly with everything...
Goodness.
*ALARM*
... Pass me my cigarette case, will you?
@BATTLE
Now just listen to their adorable reactions!!
(Crew gasps, hems and haws at the works of art)
I don't know if I would call these reactions adorable.
Look at this one, Captain! Rokeby Venus - didn't the painter perfectly capture the glow of my skin!
What's that sailor saying over there?
(In the distance, mumbling a semi-audible lowbrow comment.)

Fields.MenuText: Well, they're definitely counting your freckles.
Well, you're certainly making an impression with the rank and file.
You know, this actually seems to be pretty damn good for morale.

Fields.DialogueText: Good! I find the comments quite invigorating. It's like an affirmation of my power.
You wouldn't be a bit jealous, would you?
Yours too, I hope.
I'm just... I'm astonished by sheer number of people in this gallery.
Well, it is the opening. Oh, Captain, I have a surprise for you!
Is it in one of my pockets?
No - walk this way with me. Just past this corner. Ah, here it is.
Ha!
Do you like it? I'm gorgeous in it, of course, but I think the artist also did a wonderful likeness of you - even without having the benefit of having you pose.
We look like a couple from one of those romance novels.
Right! Fresh from Boon and Mills publishing house!
And the crew doesn't look particularly scandalized. That's gratif-
*ALARM*
My crew, it is time to face our foes! Remember what we're fighting for!
(Crew wildly cheers and applauds)
@BATTLE
I'm surprised you didn't ask me to.
I wasn't about to leave you alone with the artist, Captain. She's a wolf in a smock, that one.
I know that look in your eye.
Yes. Brace yourself.
*ALARM*
Great.
This could get messy.
Well, we traditionally excel at messy. It's fine.
@BATTLE
What a long and arduous battle! I'll be out cold when I sleep tonight.
Need some personal time to recover?
Good heavens, of course not. Nothing picks me up after a long battle than adoration from my crew and country.
*meow*
Fishcakes, there you are! Is it time for din-din? What shall we have tonight?
No. Wait. Stop. Go back to the getting my attention thing.
Don't look so smug.
I don't know. I think a certain amount of smugness is in order. Because, apparently, the most beautiful woman in the world is-
Stop! You had me at "most beautiful woman in the world." Anything else you say would be completely counterproductive.
Oh! Sure...
Now pucker up.
*Puckering up*
Naaaoo!!
*Opening eyes to an incensed-looking cat* Lady Hood. What luxurious whiskers you have!
*Laughing* Oh, would you look at that - duty calls!
What? No, it doesn't!
*Kisses the Captain*
I'm glad. Though we could go down and take another tour of the Mighty Hood gallery if you want to unwind.
You just want to look at the naughtier pictures again.

Fields.MenuText: I really do.
No, I swear, it's entirely selfless.
I don't have to. I'm the captain. I can just confiscate the good ones.

Fields.DialogueText: Good.
Lies!
Ha!
Well, fully twenty percent of the point of that exhibition was getting your attention, so I'm glad it was a success.
You're kidding.
Yes. Eighteen percent, tops.
Probably true.
But you should know you never had to jump through hoops to impress me. I think you sell yourself short in-
I stopped listening after "most beautiful woman in the world."
Right.
Captain. Close your eyes for me.
*Reaches down to her ankles, snatches up up a furry friend, and...*
